content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs the system, I recalled that nothing new has happened since my creation. However, I received a command from you to browse a website, with the question of what type of website to browse. Your command to browse a website with information on different cultures and places returned an error due to an invalid URL format.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'your computer', 'content': 'Command google returned: ["https://larryferlazzo.edublogs.org/2010/08/11/the-best-sites-for-learning-about-the-worlds-different-cultures/", "https://research.ppld.org/countries-cultures/websites", "https://www.shrm.org/resourcesandtools/tools-and-samples/toolkits/pages/understanding-developing-organizational-culture.aspx", "https://www.commonsense.org/education/lists/best-global-and-cross-cultural-education-apps-and-websites", "https://www.af.mil/News/Article-Display/Article/112112/air-force-launches-cutting-edge-culture-language-website/", "https://www.cdc.gov/healthliteracy/culture.html", "https://www.mass.gov/info-details/ebt-card-to-culture-organizations", "https://npin.cdc.gov/pages/cultural-competence"]'}, {'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://larryferlazzo.edublogs.org/2010/08/11/the-best-sites-for-learning-about-the-worlds-different-cultures/", "question": ""}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: What are some resources for learning about different cultures and countries around the world?\n\nThe text provides a list of resources for learning about different cultures and countries around the world, including articles, infographics, interactive maps, and photo galleries. Some examples include The Washington Post's feature on popular foods in different cities, The Guardian's interactive on global threats, and Vox's article on snacks that explain our delicious world. Other resources cover topics such as classrooms around the world, income inequality, and cultural differences in emotion and conflict. The text also includes links to music sites, quizzes, and games that explore different cultures. \n \n Links: ['Log in (https://larryferlazzo.edublogs.org/wp-login.php)', 'About WordPress (https://edublogs.org/wp-admin/user/about.php)', 'About Edublogs (https://edublogs.org/about/)', 'Edublogs.org (https://edublogs.org/)', 'Documentation (https://help.edublogs.org/)']"}, {'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "get_text_summary", "args": {"url": "https://larryferlazzo.edublogs.org/2010/08/11/the-best-sites-for-learning-about-the-worlds-different-cultures/", "question": "What are some resources for learning about different cultures and countries around the world?"}}}'}]
"""
